channel.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
channel.description:
Well, here's the model that won the 5th modeling contest. Here you goes... [URL=http://img232.imageshack.us/i/spearpic1.png/][IMG]http://img232.imageshack.us/img232/6120/spearpic1.png[/img][/URL] Release: http://www.mediafire.com/?xspyh3qd2jqyc2r
Don't leech please :)

[ EDIT ] Release file re-uploaded

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @Qazz Qazz
item.description:
@Qazz wrote:

I have been accused of leeching before, but I ignored it and continued modeling. I forgot to make some progress pictures for the spear , but I can show you some for my Deathbringer model if you want it.

Read full topic

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @tubefish tubefish
item.description:
@tubefish wrote:

[quote=“Qazz, post:25, topic:364506”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=460721.msg3372498#msg3372498 date=1287341883]
Based on your first post:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Where you thought that model had 30 polygons, I somewhat doubt that you made this.

Maybe you traced it, or maybe you downloaded a model and released it. (I think the second one)

Model something nice for us, WITH progress pictures (half done, etc) and I will take this back.
[/quote]
Well, actually, I figured out that I was checking the polygons of one object, not the whole thing. I was looking at the glow circle and checking that.[/quote]

Can u still make a cool model for us anyways

and show progression pics

Read full topic

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:18, topic:364506”]David doesn’t model[/quote][quote=“rip4d, post:17, topic:364506”]I just don’t think that David ever compares wireframes to see the way someone models :|[/quote]These

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:13, topic:364506”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=460721.msg3372584#msg3372584 date=1287345850]

Shhh David, it’s obviously been made in metasequoia, it’s not leeched, and it’s not even an extremely complex model. Provide some real proof then sure, we’ll consider your accusations.
[/quote]Someone else could have made it in meta But you can’t prove it’s not leeched either ^^

But I’m not going to take the time to find proof of something I don’t really care about (I’ve never modeled before in my life) Just stating my opinion. So yea, end of argument, I’ll stop posting in here now.

The way it goes is not supposed to be we find proof he didn’t leech, the way an accusation such as yours goes, is that you find proof that he did, and the accusation builds off there. You need to think about the way these things work before you accuse him, without proof, then state that he needs to get proof himself when you just made a false, as well as empty, statement.[/quote]I never said he should find the proof himself? And it’s not empty, I gave my reasons, they are just not ‘modelly’ founded.

Read full topic

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

This really isn’t hard to make at all. It had one of the better concepts, but really, look at it, it could’ve been made in under an hour, and the majority of the “spearhead’s” wireframe is a horrid mess. Also, WAAAAY to many segments were used in those rings on the model. I can just about guarantee that ~600 of the quads were just from the rings all over the model.

Read full topic

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:8, topic:364506”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=460721.msg3372498#msg3372498 date=1287341883]
Based on your first post:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Where you thought that model had 30 polygons, I somewhat doubt that you made this.

Maybe you traced it, or maybe you downloaded a model and released it. (I think the second one)

Model something nice for us, WITH progress pictures (half done, etc) and I will take this back.
[/quote]
You judge him on a model made in JUNE. Last time I checked, the amount of progress which can be made in such an extended period of time (June to October), would allow for much more progression than this. If he downloaded this model, it would surely consist of much higher quality, as well as a more professional wire frame. Jesus christ, all these accusations lately are kind of pathetic. Personally, I liked it better when the only accusations that were in this section were from CJ, who, every time he placed one, already had the download and image links for the model which was being leeched. Don’t make accusations unless you have proof, because it annoys more people than just the one who posted the model. This post is directed at EVERYONE who makes accusations without proof, and the only reason for the accusation is a comparison to a model they made months back. This is what happened to me when I first posted here, and it is NOT fun to be accused because apparently, I (in this case he) wasn’t ‘good enough’ at modeling to model what I (he) was accused for leeching. Do not respond to this with spam, or useless shit. Unless someone can post actual proof of leeching, keep it on topic, please, so that Qazz can enjoy the prize he won from the contest, as I am sure the rest of you would wish to have should you win(or have won) the contest.[/quote]If you look at the post made in June, this actually looks worse than it? Surely that large time frame would show some improvement? I am saying, based on the post in June, that it looks as if he knows nothing about modeling, and he downloads models, takes a few pictures, then releases it.

As for finding proof, I bid you good luck, the chances of making the exact same search as him and finding the exact same spear are astronomical.

And, as I said, if he can post proof that he made it, I will delete/take back my post(s), give a full apology, and post some sort of disparaging thing about myself and my experience at modeling.

Read full topic

item.title: Model contest #5: Winning model
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789

Model something nice for us, WITH progress pictures (half done, etc) and I will take this back.[/quote]
You judge him on a model made in JUNE. Last time I checked, the amount of progress which can be made in such an extended period of time (June to October), would allow for much more progression than this. If he downloaded this model, it would surely consist of much higher quality, as well as a more professional wire frame. Jesus christ, all these accusations lately are kind of pathetic. Personally, I liked it better when the only accusations that were in this section were from CJ, who, every time he placed one, already had the download and image links for the model which was being leeched. Don’t make accusations unless you have proof, because it annoys more people than just the one who posted the model. This post is directed at EVERYONE who makes accusations without proof, and the only reason for the accusation is a comparison to a model they made months back. This is what happened to me when I first posted here, and it is NOT fun to be accused because apparently, I (in this case he) wasn’t ‘good enough’ at modeling to model what I (he) was accused for leeching. Do not respond to this with spam, or useless shit. Unless someone can post actual proof of leeching, keep it on topic, please, so that Qazz can enjoy the prize he won from the contest, as I am sure the rest of you would wish to have should you win(or have won) the contest.

Read full topic
